original: de kho na bzhin du don yod pa dmigs pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du don yod pa dmigs pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that all cognitions are like that.

original: de lta yin na 'dra ba don ngo shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'dra ba don ngo shes pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, then the cognition of similarity would not be a cognition of an object,

original: nye ba la de'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir 'di'i don du 'dra ba gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba la de'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir 'di'i don du 'dra ba gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: because it is a cognition of something near.

original: de'i phyir sngar nyams su myong ba'i las tsam mam btags pa ma yin pa'am dran pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar nyams su myong ba'i las tsam mam btags pa ma yin pa'am dran pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the cognition of similarity is merely a memory of a previous experience, or that it is not a memory.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lha sbyin ni de'i don byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lha sbyin ni de'i don byed pa ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, Devadatta is not the one who performs the action,

original: de'i tshe med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that he would not exist at that time.

original: snang bzhin pa dang de'i gcig pa dang nyid ni 'di dang 'dra ba nyid kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa dang de'i gcig pa dang nyid ni 'di dang 'dra ba nyid kyi dpe'o //
translated: The similarity of the present cognition to the past cognition is the example of similarity.

original: rgyal dpog pa'i ni nyams su myong ba dang / byed pa dran pa'i mngon sum gnyis po rtogs pa ni mngon sum kho na yin par 'dod pa ni ma rig pa las byung bas kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa'i ni nyams su myong ba dang / byed pa dran pa'i mngon sum gnyis po rtogs pa ni mngon sum kho na yin par 'dod pa ni ma rig pa las byung bas kun rdzob yin no //
translated: The two direct perceptions of the Mīmāṃsakas, the direct perception of experience and the direct perception of memory, are accepted as direct perception, but they are conventional because they arise from ignorance.

original: sgra mi rtag ste /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste /
translated: Sound is impermanent,

original: bum ba bzhin du mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /🔽rigs kyis ma @266a * //
analyzed: bum ba bzhin du mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir la / rigs kyis ma @266a * //
translated: because it is apprehended by the eye, like a pot.🔽When one says that the reason is not included in the subject, the opponent replies, “A pot and sound are permanent.”

original: nges pa nyid du brjod pa na bum pa dang sgra yang rtag pa yin no zhes bya bas snga na med pa'i rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pas sngar dam bcas pa nyams pa ni phyogs kyi skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa nyid du brjod pa na bum pa dang sgra yang rtag pa yin no zhes bya bas snga na med pa'i rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pas sngar dam bcas pa nyams pa ni phyogs kyi skyon ma yin te /
translated: Since he accepts permanence that was not previously accepted, he loses his original thesis. But this is not a fault of the position.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon gyis pham pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon gyis pham pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is defeated by the fault of not being included in the subject.

original: gzhan du na gtan tshigs kyi skyon thams cad phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gtan tshigs kyi skyon thams cad phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, all faults of the reason would be faults of the position.

original: dam bca' bor ba ni blangs pa bor ba ste /
analyzed: dam bca' bor ba ni blangs pa bor ba ste /
translated: Abandoning the thesis is abandoning what was accepted.

original: sgra mi rtag ces sus smras zhes zer ba la snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi skyon kho nas pham pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ces sus smras zhes zer ba la snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi skyon kho nas pham pa yin no //
translated: When someone says, “Who says that sound is impermanent?” he is defeated by the fault of the reason alone, as before.

original: sgra nyid phyogs la yod kyang gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pa ma yin nam byas pa nyid las bzhin du gtan tshigs la yod pa chos la sogs pa la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra nyid phyogs la yod kyang gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pa ma yin nam byas pa nyid las bzhin du gtan tshigs la yod pa chos la sogs pa la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: The response to this is that just as sound itself exists in the subject, so too the logical reason exists in the subject, the property to be established, and so on.

original: mngon sum nyid yin pas rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin pas rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The response to this is that since it is directly perceptible, it is not something to be inferred.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.

original: dngos po kun la chos dang ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun la chos dang ni //
translated: The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is that all things

original: rnam dbye ni tha dad par ro //
analyzed: rnam dbye ni tha dad par ro //
translated: are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.

original: dngos po kun la zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs kyi dngos po rnams la'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun la zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs kyi dngos po rnams la'o //
translated: The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between

original: med pa'i phyir ni mngon sum la sogs pas nyams su myang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ni mngon sum la sogs pas nyams su myang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs la yang ngo //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs la yang ngo //
translated: The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between

original: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i dbye ba nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas khyad par du dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i dbye ba nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas khyad par du dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and the logical reason.🔽The response to this is that all things🔽are devoid of the distinction between🔽the property to be established and

original: dam bca' ba las byung ba'i gtan tshigs las byung ba'i phyir dam bca' ba las byung ba ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba las byung ba'i gtan tshigs las byung ba'i phyir dam bca' ba las byung ba ste /
translated: Because it arises from a reason, it arises from a reason.

original: gtan tshigs las byung ba ni mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid la dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs las byung ba ni mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid la dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: The very establishment by perception is without distinction.

original: byas pa nyid gtan tshigs la yod pa dang phyogs la yod pa'i sgra nyid ni bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid gtan tshigs la yod pa dang phyogs la yod pa'i sgra nyid ni bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The very word “sound” that exists as a reason for “being produced” and that exists as a property of the subject is the nature of the proof of the probandum.🔽The nature of the property and the subject is without distinction.

original: chos dang chos can gyi ngo bo dbye ba dang bral ba'i mar me la yang kun rdzob kyis ma yin pa'i phyir ldog pa'i dbye ba'i mthar thug pa nyid kyis mar me la yang de yod do snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi ngo bo dbye ba dang bral ba'i mar me la yang kun rdzob kyis ma yin pa'i phyir ldog pa'i dbye ba'i mthar thug pa nyid kyis mar me la yang de yod do snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The lamp also has that, because of the ultimate distinction of the negation, by means of the conventional.

original: mar me zhes bya ba nas chos can no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba nas chos can no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: The lamp, up to the subject, is the opponent’s position.

original: byed pa med la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: byed pa med la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “Without activity” is the reply.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don bya ba med pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyi rgol ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don bya ba med pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyi rgol ba'o //
translated: “Because the object of the desire to speak is without activity” is the argument that the intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni ri bong gi rva la'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni ri bong gi rva la'o //
translated: The absurd consequence is that even the horn of a rabbit would be a reason.

original: de skad du zhes bya ba ni byed pa med pa dang cig shos la sogs pa'i thun mong ba nyid kyi bya ba byed pa nyid yin gyi chos can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad du zhes bya ba ni byed pa med pa dang cig shos la sogs pa'i thun mong ba nyid kyi bya ba byed pa nyid yin gyi chos can ni ma yin no //
translated: “In that way” means that the activity of the common property, such as being without an agent, is the property to be established, not the subject.

original: sgra nyid dam thams cad ma yin pa nyid la @266b bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra nyid dam thams cad ma yin pa nyid la @266b bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction between the property to be established and the proof in terms of sound itself or in terms of not being everything.

original: byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub byed dang bsgrub bya dang chos can rnams so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub byed dang bsgrub bya dang chos can rnams so //
translated: “Being produced” and so on are the property to be established, the proof, and the subject.

original: de'i dbye ba dngos sum ma yin pa la de dang bral ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gnod byed yin par bstan pa ni don gyis rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba dngos sum ma yin pa la de dang bral ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gnod byed yin par bstan pa ni don gyis rang gi ngo bo gcig ces bya ba ste /
translated: The direct perception that apprehends the absence of that distinction in reality or in actuality is the refutation. “In reality” means that the nature of the subject is not established as the property to be established.

original: de la chos la sogs pa'i dbye ba de ma yin pa las ldog pa ma rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la chos la sogs pa'i dbye ba de ma yin pa las ldog pa ma rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the distinction of the property and so on is not understood as the exclusion of that which is not it.

original: mi rtag pa nyid gzhan nyid yin na ni tha dad pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid gzhan nyid yin na ni tha dad pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: If impermanence were different, it would be distinct.

original: mi 'thad ces bya ba ni de gnyi ga yang mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'thad ces bya ba ni de gnyi ga yang mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word not means that both are impermanent.

original: khyab pa dang cig shos zhes bya ba ni rtag pa las gzhan pa nyid ni dngos po rig pa nyid kyis rig pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa dang cig shos zhes bya ba ni rtag pa las gzhan pa nyid ni dngos po rig pa nyid kyis rig pa'o //
translated: The word pervasion means that the other is known by the very knowledge of the thing.

original: de lta na tshad ma gzhan tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na tshad ma gzhan tshad ma yin te /
translated: Thus, another valid cognition is a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba dag gis zhes bstan pa ni dus gzhan khyab na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba dag gis zhes bstan pa ni dus gzhan khyab na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement by inference and contradiction is shown by if the pervasion is at another time.

original: khyab pa dang cig shos nyid dngos po las tha dad pa yin pas de 'dzin gzung bya ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni 'o na te mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa dang cig shos nyid dngos po las tha dad pa yin pas de 'dzin gzung bya ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni 'o na te mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since pervasion and the other are different from things, is it not the case that they are not apprehended? The statement then by perception is made.

original: khyab pa nyid ni gzhan la ltos pas gzhan yin par 'gyur gyi de dang bral ba'i ngo bo mi rtag pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid ni gzhan la ltos pas gzhan yin par 'gyur gyi de dang bral ba'i ngo bo mi rtag pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since pervasion depends on another, it would be different. The statement impermanence shows that the nature free from that is not impermanent.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni khyab pa nyid de mi rtag pa nyid du ma rtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni khyab pa nyid de mi rtag pa nyid du ma rtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “That itself” is the pervasion, which is to be applied to “not understood as impermanent.”

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni khyab pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni khyab pa can gyi'o //
translated: “That itself” is the pervader.

original: yod dam zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yod dam zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “Exists” is in terms of being the object of observation.

original: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni dbye ba byed pa de nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni dbye ba byed pa de nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “In the nature of that” is the consequence of not being a distinguisher of that itself.

original: med pas zhes bya ba ni ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: med pas zhes bya ba ni ma dmigs pas so //
translated: “Because of non-existence” is because of not being observed.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni sngar dmigs pa chos dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni sngar dmigs pa chos dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: “By this” is the previously observed absence of the object of the attribute.

original: chos can 'dzin pa la chos mi 'dzin na skyon gzhan bstan pa ni ma grub na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can 'dzin pa la chos mi 'dzin na skyon gzhan bstan pa ni ma grub na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the attribute is not apprehended in the apprehension of the attribute-possessor, the other fault is taught: “If it is not established.”

original: mngon sum gyis mi rtag par 'dzin pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mi rtag par 'dzin pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
translated: The quality of the apprehension of impermanence by direct perception is taught:

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “When . . .”

original: gzhan yang mngon sum gyis chos dang chos dang can 'dzin pa thams cad du 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum gyis chos dang chos dang can 'dzin pa thams cad du 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it is said that inference is pointless because perception apprehends all phenomena and subjects that possess phenomena.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is said, No,

original: 'di la chos yod pa'i phyir chos can ni mi 'dzin na mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'di la chos yod pa'i phyir chos can ni mi 'dzin na mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: then it is said that if the subject is not apprehended because the phenomenon does not exist,

original: chos ni mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos ni mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the phenomenon is not apprehended by perception.

original: 'ga' dang lhan cig 'dzin yang chos gzhan dang ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'ga' dang lhan cig 'dzin yang chos gzhan dang ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: It is said that even if it is apprehended together with something, it is not with another phenomenon.

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said, It is a phenomenon of error,

original: tho yor nyid la @267a * //
analyzed: tho yor nyid la @267a * //
translated: a scarecrow

original: sogs pa dang bral ba yang dbyibs sngon du 'gro ba nyid du mthong ba yin gyi khyab pa can dang cig shos dang bral ba'i dngos so //
analyzed: sogs pa dang bral ba yang dbyibs sngon du 'gro ba nyid du mthong ba yin gyi khyab pa can dang cig shos dang bral ba'i dngos so //
translated: is seen to precede the shape, but not the thing that is devoid of the pervasion and the other.

original: bzung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni mi dang tho yor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni mi dang tho yor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that it is not apprehended is a man and a scarecrow.

original: yul khyab pa can la gzhan du 'dzin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yul khyab pa can la gzhan du 'dzin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a pervaded object is apprehended as something else,

original: dus khyab pa can yang gzhan du 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni gal te ring po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus khyab pa can yang gzhan du 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni gal te ring po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It would be held to be all-pervading in time.

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni gcig g-yo ba ni gzhan g-yo ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni gcig g-yo ba ni gzhan g-yo ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas so //
translated: “By inference” means that it is not tenable that the movement of one thing is the movement of another, because the movement of one thing is not the movement of another.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi dngos po gnyis bzhin du gcig g-yo ba ni gzhan g-yo ba ni tha dad pa yin yang ci las kyang yin ba'i phyir gzhan du mi 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi dngos po gnyis bzhin du gcig g-yo ba ni gzhan g-yo ba ni tha dad pa yin yang ci las kyang yin ba'i phyir gzhan du mi 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as in the case of two machines, although the movement of one thing is the movement of another, it is not tenable that it is not the case that one thing is the cause of another.

original: mthong ba rnams kyi gcig pa nyid mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba rnams kyi gcig pa nyid mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That is also seen” shows that the identity of the two is contradicted by perception.

original: dus snga ma'i brda'i yul gyi khyad par mi 'dzin pa des khyad par du byas pa da ltar ba mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin par bstan pa ni ma yin te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus snga ma'i brda'i yul gyi khyad par mi 'dzin pa des khyad par du byas pa da ltar ba mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin par bstan pa ni ma yin te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: “That itself” shows that the present object qualified by the particular object of the convention of the past time is not apprehended by perception.

original: da ltar ba'i brda'i yul gyi khyad par 'dzin pa ni des khyad par du byas pa 'dzin pa ni des khyad par du byas pa 'dzin na mi rtag pa nyid kho nar 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni des na mi rtag pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o🔽// rtog pa tsam gyis sbyar ba ni sgrub byed dam cig shos kyang ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i brda'i yul gyi khyad par 'dzin pa ni des khyad par du byas pa 'dzin pa ni des khyad par du byas pa 'dzin na mi rtag pa nyid kho nar 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni des na mi rtag pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o // rtog pa tsam gyis sbyar ba ni sgrub byed dam cig shos kyang ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The apprehension of the particular of the object of the sign that exists now is the apprehension of that as qualified. The statement that it apprehends only impermanence is “Therefore, impermanence . . .”

original: 'brel pa yod pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the application by mere conception is neither the probandum nor the other because of the absence of relation is “From the existence of the relation . . .”

original: gcig las zhes bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba las so //
analyzed: gcig las zhes bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba las so //
translated: The statement that the one is from any one of the non-cows, etc., is “From one . . .”

original: du ma ni khra bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du ma ni khra bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The many is the multicolored, etc.

original: tha dad pa'i ldog pa las yang mngon sum pa ni rnam par rtog pa bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pas gcig nyid du zhen pa yin par bstan pa ni dngos po kun gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i ldog pa las yang mngon sum pa ni rnam par rtog pa bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pas gcig nyid du zhen pa yin par bstan pa ni dngos po kun gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the direct perception is the conception that conceives one from the different exclusions that arise from latent potentialities is “All things . . .”

original: bag chags de dang lhan cig byed ba'i dbang po las byung ba'i mngon sum nyid der rtog par byed pa yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags de dang lhan cig byed ba'i dbang po las byung ba'i mngon sum nyid der rtog par byed pa yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is also shown that the direct perception that arises from the sense faculty that is the cooperating cause of that latent impression is conceptual.

original: gal te dbang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it arises from the sense faculty, etc.

original: dbang po las byung ba ni dbang po bzhin du yod pa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba ni dbang po bzhin du yod pa'i yul can yin la /
translated: That which arises from the sense faculty has an existent object, like the sense faculty.

original: bag chags byung ba ni yul yod pa ma yin pas rtog pa can yin par bstan pa ni snga ma phyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags byung ba ni yul yod pa ma yin pas rtog pa can yin par bstan pa ni snga ma phyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which arises from a latent impression does not have an existent object. The statement that it is conceptual is the second.

original: rjes 'gro med ces bya ba ni gsal ba re re zhing nges pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes 'gro med ces bya ba ni gsal ba re re zhing nges pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not follow, etc.

original: gsal ba du ma 'dzin kyang rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin pa @267b ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba du ma 'dzin kyang rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin pa @267b ma yin te /
translated: Even though it apprehends many manifestations, it does not apprehend what follows.

original: gsal ba gcig 'dzin pa bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba gcig 'dzin pa bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as it apprehends one manifestation, it does not follow. The statement that it does not follow is the third.

original: gang gis bya ba ste don gzhan du mthong ba dang lhan cig gcig nyid du gzhan du yang ma mthong ba dang rjes su 'gro ba nub pa dang ldan pa nyid du snang ba'i rgyu la goms pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bya ba ste don gzhan du mthong ba dang lhan cig gcig nyid du gzhan du yang ma mthong ba dang rjes su 'gro ba nub pa dang ldan pa nyid du snang ba'i rgyu la goms pa yin no //
translated: By whom? By one who has become accustomed to the cause of the appearance of the non-perception of identity with the other, which is seen as a different object, and the perception of the non-perception of difference with the other, which is seen as the disappearance of the pervasion.

original: de bstan pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is taught by “the wall, etc.”

original: gsal ba dag gi dus phyis rtogs pa snga ma'i gsal ba zhig pa na byung ba ji ltar de'i khyab pa nyid kyi yul yin zhes zer ba la ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba dag gi dus phyis rtogs pa snga ma'i gsal ba zhig pa na byung ba ji ltar de'i khyab pa nyid kyi yul yin zhes zer ba la ma yin te /
translated: When the previous cognition of the manifestation has ceased, how can the later cognition of the manifestation be the object of its pervasion?

original: gsal ba yod pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba yod pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not so, because of the existence of the manifestation.

original: snga mar zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'i yul gyi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: snga mar zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'i yul gyi phyogs su'o //
translated: “The previous” means in the place of the object seen before.

original: khyab pa nyid du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rgol ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rgol ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The objection is stated: “Because there is no pervasion.”

original: de'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Its nature” means the nature of the previous one.

original: de'i gzhan du ba nyid ma rtogs pa mngon sum gyis ma grub pa la mngon sum dang bral ba'i zhes pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: de'i gzhan du ba nyid ma rtogs pa mngon sum gyis ma grub pa la mngon sum dang bral ba'i zhes pa tsam yin la /
translated: The non-realization of its difference is not established by perception, so it is merely said to be devoid of perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not established by direct perception, it is neither different nor non-different. In order to demonstrate this, he says, “mutually.”

original: tha dad las gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad las gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Other than different” means “other than different.”

original: de tshe zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa na'o //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa na'o //
translated: “At that time” means when there is difference.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang kho nas tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang kho nas tha dad pa'o //
translated: “By that very thing” means by what is different.

original: de yang ni zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa nyid du gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ni zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa nyid du gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: “That also” means non-difference does not remain,

original: yang tha dad par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang tha dad par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it goes to difference again.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba la khyad par med pa'i thal 'gyur yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba mthong bar min par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba la khyad par med pa'i thal 'gyur yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba mthong bar min par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reductio that there is no difference in contradiction because of difference and non-difference, he says, “what is seen is not seen.”

original: ldog pa ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi nye bar len pa'i rnam par rtog pa las chos la sogs pa'i dbye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ldog pa ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi nye bar len pa'i rnam par rtog pa las chos la sogs pa'i dbye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the differentiation of dharmas, etc. is not from the conceptualization of the particular of non-exclusion, he says,

original: gang la de med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la de med ces bya ba'o //
translated: “where that does not exist.”

original: kal te kun rdzob tu rnam par dbye ba yod na dngos po thams cad la chos la sogs pa'i dbye ba ji ltar ma grub pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: kal te kun rdzob tu rnam par dbye ba yod na dngos po thams cad la chos la sogs pa'i dbye ba ji ltar ma grub pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: If there is a division in the conventional, how is it that all things are not established as having the division of universals, etc.?

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the ultimate, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gcig nyid de gsal bas rigs la sogs pa ste ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gcig nyid de gsal bas rigs la sogs pa ste ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That itself is oneness, and the universal, etc. are manifested by the individual, as in “the cow.”

original: gzhan nyid ni ba lang nyid ces bya ba ste 'gog par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni ba lang nyid ces bya ba ste 'gog par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Otherness is the cow itself, and is refuted.

original: ci las she na mngon sum las de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci las she na mngon sum las de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From what? From perception, because it is not established.

original: de 'brel pa nyid du gang du gnas pa yin zhe na kun rdzob pa'i rnams la'o //
analyzed: de 'brel pa nyid du gang du gnas pa yin zhe na kun rdzob pa'i rnams la'o //
translated: In what is it that it abides as a connection? In the conventional.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rtog pa las de ltar rtogs pa ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rtog pa las de ltar rtogs pa ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The understanding of it as such from the conception of the latent potentialities of conceptualization is that of the Vaibhāṣika.

original: gzhan dag ni don dam par rnam par bcad pa'i @268a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni don dam par rnam par bcad pa'i @268a * //
translated: Others, in the ultimate, refute the division of the universal, etc.

original: gnas skabs rnams la gnas pa de la brten pas kun rdzob pa rnams la 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams la gnas pa de la brten pas kun rdzob pa rnams la 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The conventional is stopped in regard to that abiding in the states, because it is based on that.

original: gsal ba nyid de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa la tha mi dad par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa la tha mi dad par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
translated: The expression attachment to identity and difference in regard to the manifest, which is different from that, is well known.

original: don dam par rnam par dpyad pa mngon sum gyi don gyi yul rnams la de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rnam par dpyad pa mngon sum gyi don gyi yul rnams la de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of direct perception, which is investigated in the ultimate, is not established in that way, that is, because the classification of phenomena, etc. is not established.

original: gzhan nyid ni gsal bar 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni gsal bar 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Difference is stopped in regard to the manifest.

original: rtog pa la grub pa'i phyir de nyid yin gyi ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni de nyid ma yin par 'gog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa la grub pa'i phyir de nyid yin gyi ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni de nyid ma yin par 'gog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because it is established in thought, it is identity, but it is not stopped by the reason of difference.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ma yin na gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel par ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ma yin na gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel par ro //
translated: If it is not the reason for that, it is difference. This is in the commentary.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'gog pa yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'gog pa yin la /
translated: Existing conventionally, etc. stops that very thing.

original: des na tha dad pa zhes bya bas ni gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa zhes bya bas ni gzhan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, “different” means “other.”

original: de dag ni kun rdzob pa yin la mngon sum med pas de dag la rjes su dpag pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag ni kun rdzob pa yin la mngon sum med pas de dag la rjes su dpag pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: These are conventional, and since there is no perception, it is shown that there is no inference with regard to them:

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can //
translated: “Having perception as a prerequisite.”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: sgrub byed rang bzhin ni phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed rang bzhin ni phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proof is the property of the subject, etc.

original: kun rdzob gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the conventional is called “the nature of the conventional existence.”

original: mngon sum pa ni gsal ba tsam yin gyi chos la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum pa ni gsal ba tsam yin gyi chos la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is shown that perception is mere clarity and not a property, etc. :🔽“In that very case.”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo las so //
translated: “From that” means from the nature of clarity.

original: khyad par rig mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rig par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par rig mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rig par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “The distinction is not known” means that clarity is not known.

original: rdzogs med pas ni rtogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: rdzogs med pas ni rtogs pa med pas so //
translated: “Without completion” means without realization.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i spyi btags pa ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i spyi btags pa ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni ;
translated: It is shown that the universal of the nature of properties, non-properties, etc. is merely imputed:🔽“The universal of the nature of properties, etc.”

original: de'i phyir spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called a universal.🔽When one sees an instance of the universal, the cognition, etc.

original: ldog pa'i gsal ba mthong na blo'i zhes bya ba ni blo skyes pa na gsal ba la 'jug pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin par bstan pa ni de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i gsal ba mthong na blo'i zhes bya ba ni blo skyes pa na gsal ba la 'jug pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin par bstan pa ni de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the cognition of the universal has the instance as its object is taught by the words “in that way.”

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la spyi zhes bya ba'o //🔽rtog pa tsam gyis gsal ba'i 'bras bu las 'jug na spyi ma gtogs par bstan pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la spyi zhes bya ba'o // rtog pa tsam gyis gsal ba'i 'bras bu las 'jug na spyi ma gtogs par bstan pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the universal is the same as the instance is taught by the words “because of the similarity.”🔽The statement that the cognition of the universal is produced by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”

original: 'jug pa med pa ni gsal ba mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa ni gsal ba mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gsal ba gzhan gyis de kho na bzhin rjes su dpag par bya ba'i khyab pa 'dzin pa yin na rjes su dpag par bya ba grub @268b pa la go byed ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /🔽spyi ni khyab pa nyid yin yang //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gsal ba gzhan gyis de kho na bzhin rjes su dpag par bya ba'i khyab pa 'dzin pa yin na rjes su dpag par bya ba grub @268b pa la go byed ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / spyi ni khyab pa nyid yin yang //
translated: The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested by the instance.”🔽The statement that the universal is manifested by the instance is taught by the words “because the universal is manifested

original: de kho na bzhin du ma 'dzin na ni rtogs pa ma yin te 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te spyi khyab ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ma 'dzin na ni rtogs pa ma yin te 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te spyi khyab ces bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not apprehend the universal in that way, then there is no cognition, because there is no apprehension of the relation. This is taught by “If the universal . . .”

original: ma rtogs pa'i 'grel pa can rtogs pa yin na thal tshes pa yin la 'grel pa can yang de ltar ma rtogs na rtags ma yin te khyab tshes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'brel ba ma bzung ba las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i 'grel pa can rtogs pa yin na thal tshes pa yin la 'grel pa can yang de ltar ma rtogs na rtags ma yin te khyab tshes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'brel ba ma bzung ba las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is cognition of the related object when there is no cognition of the relation, then there is no reason for the relation, and if the related object is not cognized in that way, then there is no reason for the relation. This is taught by “Nor is there a reason for the relation . . .”

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba can gyi spyi'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba can gyi spyi'o //
translated: “That” refers to the universal that is related.

original: mngon sum 'jug pa de gang gi yin pa de chos can gyi sgra nyid kyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa de gang gi yin pa de chos can gyi sgra nyid kyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “That” refers to the object that is the basis of the direct perception. “That” is connected to “the word ‘object.’”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: “That” refers to the particular.

original: de rig pa ni khyad par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rig pa ni khyad par rig pa'o //
translated: “Knowledge of that” is knowledge of the particular.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni khyad par gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni khyad par gyi'o //
translated: “The nature of that” is the nature of the particular.

original: sngar nyid du ni rtogs pa med pa la'o //
analyzed: sngar nyid du ni rtogs pa med pa la'o //
translated: “Previously” means before.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo la'o //
translated: “In regard to which” refers to the nature of the individual.

original: mgron bya bas zhes bya bas spyi'i 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: mgron bya bas zhes bya bas spyi'i 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The word cow indicates the particular.

original: chag po zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa nyid kyi'o //🔽gzhan du mi 'thad pas zhes bya ba ni ma he la sogs pa bor nas ba lang gi sgra las 'gro ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chag po zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa nyid kyi'o // gzhan du mi 'thad pas zhes bya ba ni ma he la sogs pa bor nas ba lang gi sgra las 'gro ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word elsewhere indicates that it is not tenable.

original: mi 'dra ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni ma he dang mi 'dra ba'i ba lang gi tshogs so //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni ma he dang mi 'dra ba'i ba lang gi tshogs so //
translated: The word dissimilar indicates the collection of cows that are dissimilar to buffaloes.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni ba lang dang ma he dag go //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni ba lang dang ma he dag go //
translated: The word two indicates cows and buffaloes.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
translated: The word that indicates the universal.🔽 The word not indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.

original: thams cad mthong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la ni ba lang nyid kyi rten thams cad ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mthong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la ni ba lang nyid kyi rten thams cad ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.

original: des na de yang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i spyi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: des na de yang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i spyi mthong ba'o //
translated: The word that indicates the seen universal.

original: spyi yang gsal ba ma lus pa sde tshan du mi byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi yang gsal ba ma lus pa sde tshan du mi byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.

original: de la rtogs bya ma yin par bstan pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rtogs bya ma yin par bstan pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cowness are infinite.🔽 The word that indicates the seen universal.🔽 The word also indicates that the universal is not seen in all individual cows, because the substrata of cown

original: gsal ba ni snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba ni snang ba nyid do //
translated: “Manifestation” is the appearance of the cow itself.🔽Since the universal of cowness is indicated by the manifestation of a few cows, the convention is made. Therefore, it is said, “Having seen one manifestation, one says, ‘I have seen a cow.’ ”🔽The meaning is that prior to the convention, the universal of cowness is not distinguished as that which is common to all cows.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.

original: gsal ba nyung shas rnams la ba lang nyid kyi spyi nye bar mtshon pa nas brngas tha snyad byed pa'i phyir sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa las de nyid du mthong ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la gsal ba gcig mthong nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsal ba nyung shas rnams la ba lang nyid kyi spyi nye bar mtshon pa nas brngas tha snyad byed pa'i phyir sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa las de nyid du mthong ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la gsal ba gcig mthong nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.

original: brda'i snga rol du rta nyid dang bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi khyad par can ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brda'i snga rol du rta nyid dang bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi khyad par can ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir gsal ba'i khyad par yin no snyam du sems pa ni gang zhig 'di lta bur zhes bya ba'o //🔽brda'i las phyis kyi dus na khyad par can nyid ni de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ba ni ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir gsal ba'i khyad par yin no snyam du sems pa ni gang zhig 'di lta bur zhes bya ba'o //🔽brda'i las phyis kyi dus na khyad par can nyid ni de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ba ni ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the universal of cowness is distinguished by the manifestation of a dewlap, etc.🔽The meaning is that the universal of cowness is

original: mi 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ldog pa @269a * //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ldog pa @269a * //
translated: “Because it does not engage” means because it does not revert.

original: nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nyid kyis so //
translated: By the very fact that it does not engage, i.e., by the very fact that it does not apprehend.

original: khra bo la sogs pa bzhin du gsal ba las tha dad pa ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i blo la snang bar ma yin par bstan pa ni shes pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa bzhin du gsal ba las tha dad pa ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i blo la snang bar ma yin par bstan pa ni shes pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the case that the cognition of a cow appears as something different from the manifestation, like a multicolored object, as is shown by the words, “there is no cognition. ”

original: de lta na rigs mi mthun pa las log pa ni spyis byas pa yin no snyam du sems pa la rigs mi mthun ba las kyang zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na rigs mi mthun pa las log pa ni spyis byas pa yin no snyam du sems pa la rigs mi mthun ba las kyang zhes bya ba smos so // de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the exclusion from what is of a different class is also accomplished by the universal, as is shown by the words, “even from what is of a different class. ”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las so //
translated: “From that” means from what is of a different class.

original: gcig pa ni khra bo'o //
analyzed: gcig pa ni khra bo'o //
translated: “The same” means the multicolored.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni thu yu'o //🔽ji ltar de las log pa de ltar ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni thu yu'o // ji ltar de las log pa de ltar ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: “The other” means the cow.

original: gzhan du ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As is shown by the words, “it is not the case that it is not like that, ” it is not the case that the exclusion from that is not like that.🔽“It is not the case that it is not different” means that it is not the case that it is not different from that.

original: log pa nyid ldog pa min na //
analyzed: log pa nyid ldog pa min na //
translated: If the exclusion itself is not the negation,

original: de yang tha dad ba la tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ni rtog ba'i yul nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: de yang tha dad ba la tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ni rtog ba'i yul nyid kyis yin te /
translated: then the object of the convention of non-difference with regard to difference is just the imagined object, because

original: spyi lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba'o //🔽las ma yin pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dag go //
analyzed: spyi lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba'o // las ma yin pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dag go //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the universal is also a conventional name.🔽A substance is not an action, and a quality is not an action.

original: rdzas ma yin pa ni las dang yon tan dag go //
analyzed: rdzas ma yin pa ni las dang yon tan dag go //
translated: An action is not a substance, and an action is not a quality.

original: dper na bram zer ma yin ba la bram ze nyid ma yin par dgag pa ni skyes bu nyid kyi rten yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la spyi rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na bram zer ma yin ba la bram ze nyid ma yin par dgag pa ni skyes bu nyid kyi rten yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la spyi rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the negation of non-Brahmin is the basis of Brahmin, so too is the negation of non-cow the basis of cow.

original: bram ze ma yin pa las gzhan pa nyid bram ze yin gyi de med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bram ze ma yin pa las gzhan pa nyid bram ze yin gyi de med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Non-Brahmin is not the absence of Brahmin,

original: dgag pa don du ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa don du ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because negation has multiple meanings.

original: de bzhin du ba lang ma yin pa yang gzhan kho na yin te 'jug pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhan ba lang nyid tsam sgra las byung ba yin gyi gzhan nyid ni des mtshan pa'i gsal ba dang sbyor ba'i dbye ba las yin no snyam du sems pa
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang ma yin pa yang gzhan kho na yin te 'jug pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhan ba lang nyid tsam sgra las byung ba yin gyi gzhan nyid ni des mtshan pa'i gsal ba dang sbyor ba'i dbye ba las yin no snyam du sems pa
translated: Similarly, non-cow is just another cow, because it is the object of engagement. The mere otherness of cow is understood from the word, but the otherness characterized by that is understood from the division of application.🔽Thinking this, the author of the commentary says:

original: ni / 'on te spyi rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni / 'on te spyi rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or rather, “the universals”?

original: gsal ba yang rang gi ngo bo nyid du mtshon par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gsal ba yang rang gi ngo bo nyid du mtshon par 'gyur la /
translated: The manifestation would be characterized by its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan nyid yin na spyi nyid yin par bstan ba ni ngo bos tha dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan nyid yin na spyi nyid yin par bstan ba ni ngo bos tha dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: If its own nature were different, it would be a universal. The expression “by its own nature” shows that.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i sbyor ba las so //
translated: “From another” means from the application of the manifestation.

original: spyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because it is endowed with all universals” means because it is mixed.

original: mig las byung ba las gzugs tsam dang reg pa las byung ba las reg bya tsam nyid du snang ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig las byung ba las gzugs tsam dang reg pa las byung ba las reg bya tsam nyid du snang ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Only form appears from the eye and only the tangible appears from contact, and not anything else.

original: gzhan du sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni de nyid kyis gnod pa byas pa yin par bstan pa ni gzugs sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni de nyid kyis gnod pa byas pa yin par bstan pa ni gzugs sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The recognition of what was previously seen is contradicted by that very fact. This is shown by the expression “form, etc.”

original: mthong ba dang reg pa'i yul las yul gzhan sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa'i yul las yul gzhan sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The recognition of what was previously seen is not from another object, from the object of sight or touch.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is shown by the expression “because it follows that.”

original: dran pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Without memory” means without memory of the object.

original: de'i @269b tshe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg bya la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //🔽rim gyis gzhan len pa dang 'dzin pa na rnam par bzung ba tsam rjes su 'brang bar bya ba yin gyi lhag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i @269b tshe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg bya la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na'o // rim gyis gzhan len pa dang 'dzin pa na rnam par bzung ba tsam rjes su 'brang bar bya ba yin gyi lhag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: “At that time” means at the time of the apprehension of form, touch, etc.🔽“In succession” means that the apprehension of the other is the mere continuation of the apprehension of the first, and not a new one.

original: phyogs gcig gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In part” means that the apprehension of the other is not the apprehension of the whole.

original: ji ltar yan lag can rnams zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag can rnams zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Just as the possessor of parts” means that the possessor of parts is the object of the apprehension.

original: yan lag la sogs pa skad cig re re zhing 'phel bar yang lag can gyi khyad par yin pa'i dgongs bas mang po'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yan lag la sogs pa skad cig re re zhing 'phel bar yang lag can gyi khyad par yin pa'i dgongs bas mang po'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word “parts” is used in the sense of “moments,” because the possessor of parts is the difference of the moments.

original: sngar mthong ba do shes pa nyid snga na med pa'i don mthong ba ni yan lag can 'dzin pa yin gyi snga ma la ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba do shes pa nyid snga na med pa'i don mthong ba ni yan lag can 'dzin pa yin gyi snga ma la ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The idea is that the apprehension of the possessor of parts is the apprehension of the object not previously seen, and not the previous one.

original: 'on te dran pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te dran pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Or together with memory” means that the apprehension of the possessor of parts is the apprehension of the object not previously seen, and not the previous one.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi go bya'i yan lag can yin na med pa yang de'i go byar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi go bya'i yan lag can yin na med pa yang de'i go byar 'gyur te /
translated: If it has a part that is merely an understanding, then a non-existent would be its object of understanding,

original: nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dang lhan cig pa nyid la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dang lhan cig pa nyid la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because there is no difference in the simultaneous presence of experience and memory.

original: de'i tshe yan lag dang yon tan gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yan lag dang yon tan gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by “at that time, with respect to another part or quality.”

original: ma bral ba'i yul nyid kyis kyang sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni rnam par phye ba'i rtog pas gnod par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni mi dbye ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma bral ba'i yul nyid kyis kyang sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni rnam par phye ba'i rtog pas gnod par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni mi dbye ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also, recognition of what was previously seen by means of an object that is not separated is not harmed by the conception that distinguishes. This is taught by “without distinguishing.”

original: de las gzhan pa la ni gnod pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la ni gnod pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is only harmed with respect to something other than that.

original: dran pa dang ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by “memory and recognition.”

original: tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa yang tshad ma nyid yin na don med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni tshad ma don med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa yang tshad ma nyid yin na don med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni tshad ma don med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If something that is external to the presentation of valid knowledge were valid knowledge, it would be pointless. This is taught by “valid knowledge would be pointless.”

original: dran bzhin pas bzhin du gzung bzhin pa la 'dzin par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: dran bzhin pas bzhin du gzung bzhin pa la 'dzin par 'gyur ro /
translated: It is apprehended by the apprehension of that which is being remembered.

original: bar rjes su dpog pas tha mi dad pa'i rjes su zhugs pa mthong bas gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar rjes su dpog pas tha mi dad pa'i rjes su zhugs pa mthong bas gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of the refutation by perception of the non-difference of the object of inference and the object of memory is as follows: The object of inference is the object of memory.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dbye bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dbye bas so //
translated: “Otherwise” means by division.

original: gcig nyid ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid ni byed pa po'o //
translated: The one is the agent.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul la'o //
translated: The object of inference is the object of memory.

original: du ma'i yul can zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma'i yul can zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the many is the object of similarity.

original: don de byed pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid dang rgyu mtshan yang ngo //
analyzed: don de byed pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid dang rgyu mtshan yang ngo //
translated: The reason for that is the very activity.

original: 'dra ba rnams la snga ma snga ma'i bag chags las gcig nyid du brtag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dra ba rnams la snga ma snga ma'i bag chags las gcig nyid du brtag pa yin la /
translated: The one is imagined in the similar ones from the habitual tendency of the former.🔽The reason for the superimposition of the present is the principal one.

original: da ltar ba rnams la ni der sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas gtso bor brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar ba rnams la ni der sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas gtso bor brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of that is as follows:

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las //
translated: From beginningless habitual tendencies,

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽yang na dang po'i bya ba @270a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // yang na dang po'i bya ba @270a * //
translated: So it is said.

original: byed pa tsam las skad cig ma gzhan las de dang 'dra ba nyid las der tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni yang na dang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa tsam las skad cig ma gzhan las de dang 'dra ba nyid las der tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni yang na dang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, the object that is the basis for the convention is taught to be the mere performance of the first action and the similarity to that in other moments.🔽Or, the first, etc.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu dag gi dkar po nyid ni chos can tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir snam bu nyid kyi dkar po dang cig shos la sogs pa chos can gyi de
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu dag gi dkar po nyid ni chos can tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir snam bu nyid kyi dkar po dang cig shos la sogs pa chos can gyi de
translated: The whiteness of a pot and a cloth, though different substrates, are not different, because the whiteness of the cloth, etc., are the same reality as the other.

original: kho na nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: kho na nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the same.

original: ci las she na de nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci las she na de nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From what? From that.

original: 'di dag tha dad pa ma yin yang rig pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag tha dad pa ma yin yang rig pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Though these are not different, they are different by way of awareness.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par yin gyi de dag tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyis byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par yin gyi de dag tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The so-called inference produced by beginningless latent impressions is a special type of conception, but it is not just those.

original: don dam pa ma yin pa ni bden pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin pa ni bden pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The non-ultimate is not true.

original: yod pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Existence is in the conventional.

original: de lta bur gyur ma grub phyir //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ma grub phyir //
translated: Because it is not established in that way,

original: zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not established.🔽That very refutation of sameness and difference will be stated,

original: de nyid gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba gang du zhe na don dam par rnam par dpyad na'o//
analyzed: de nyid gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba gang du zhe na don dam par rnam par dpyad na'o//
translated: where? In ultimate analysis.

original: gang du gnas she na kun rdzob pa'i dngos rnams la zhes bya bar sbyar ba'o //🔽tha mi dad ces bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dbyer med pa'o //🔽gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ste dbye ba mngon sum pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du gnas she na kun rdzob pa'i dngos rnams la zhes bya bar sbyar ba'o // tha mi dad ces bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dbyer med pa'o // gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ste dbye ba mngon sum pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Where does it abide? In conventional things.🔽Non-difference means not being divisible into sameness and difference.🔽Both means sameness and difference. The division is not manifest.

original: tha dad la zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du'o //
analyzed: tha dad la zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du'o //
translated: In difference means in sameness and difference.

original: shes pa la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rtog pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rtog pas grub pa'o //
translated: “Consciousness” is established by the conceptual thought that is excluded.

original: shes pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba mi slu ba can yin gyi rnam par rtog pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba mi slu ba can yin gyi rnam par rtog pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness arises from beginningless habitual tendencies and is non-deceptive, but it is not mere conceptual thought.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhin du sun dbyung bar bya ba dang / sun 'byin par bya ba yang rtog pa tsam las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha dad pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhin du sun dbyung bar bya ba dang / sun 'byin par bya ba yang rtog pa tsam las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha dad pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o /
translated: Therefore, just as there is a distinction between inference and what is to be inferred, and so on, the distinction between what is to be refuted and the refutation is also taught to arise from mere conceptual thought.

original: bstan pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha dad pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o /
analyzed: bstan pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha dad pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o /
translated: The distinction between the two truths is taught to be like the distinction between what is to be refuted and the refutation.

original: sum la'o // brtags pa ba la ni gnyi ga mi slu ba yin la gzhan la ni gnyi ga ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sum la'o // brtags pa ba la ni gnyi ga mi slu ba yin la gzhan la ni gnyi ga ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the case of the imagined, both are non-deceptive, and in the case of the other, both are not non-deceptive, is this not so?

original: de'i phyir khyad par ci zhig yod ces zer ba la bdag nyid ji lta'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par ci zhig yod ces zer ba la bdag nyid ji lta'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, what is the difference?
